extendedIngredients.name: broccoli rabe
extendedIngredients.original: 4 pounds broccoli rabe, large stems discarded

extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulbs
extendedIngredients.original: 2 medium fennel bulbs, cored and coarsely chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: fennel bulbs, cored and coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: italian tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 2 35-ounce cans whole peeled Italian tomatoes, drained and chopped
extendedIngredients.originalName: whole peeled Italian tomatoes, drained and chopped

title: Stewed Broccoli Rabe with Spicy Tomato Sauce
summary: Stewed Broccoli Rabe with Spicy Tomato Sauce is a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish. One serving contains 245 calories, 9g of protein, and 16g of fat. For $2.53 per serving, this recipe covers 30% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 10. If you have salt, carrots, pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour and 30 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 91%, this dish is tremendous. Similar recipes include Pasta with Spicy Italian Sausage, Broccoli Rabe, and Sun-dried Tomato Pesto, Spicy Garlic Broccoli Rabe, and Spicy Braised Broccoli Rabe.
instructions: In a food processor, finely chop the fennel and carrots. In a large saucepan, heat 1/3 cup of the olive oil. Add the onions, garlic, rosemary and the fennel mixture and cook over moderately low heat, stirring often, until the onions are very tender and starting to brown, about 25 minutes.                                              Add the crushed red pepper to the saucepan and cook over moderately low heat, stirring, for 1 minute. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thick, about 10 minutes; discard the rosemary sprigs.                                              Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the broccoli rabe until bright green, about 4 minutes. Drain and let cool, then coarsely chop.                                              In a large, deep skillet, heat the remaining 1/3 cup of olive oil. Add the broccoli rabe and cook over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until starting to brown, about 4 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and simmer over low heat until very thick, about 15 minutes. Season with salt. Transfer the broccoli rabe to a bowl and serve.

steps.step: In a food processor, finely chop the fennel and carrots. In a large saucepan, heat 1/3 cup of the olive oil.
Add the onions, garlic, rosemary and the fennel mixture and cook over moderately low heat, stirring often, until the onions are very tender and starting to brown, about 25 minutes.
Add the crushed red pepper to the saucepan and cook over moderately low heat, stirring, for 1 minute.
Add the chopped tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce is thick, about 10 minutes; discard the rosemary sprigs.
Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the broccoli rabe until bright green, about 4 minutes.
Drain and let cool, then coarsely chop.
In a large, deep skillet, heat the remaining 1/3 cup of olive oil.
Add the broccoli rabe and cook over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until starting to brown, about 4 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce and simmer over low heat until very thick, about 15 minutes. Season with salt.
Transfer the broccoli rabe to a bowl and serve.
